ygData.subject: Re: Guard Killing (Was Evil Characters)
ygData.msgSnippet: The Dwarven guards are  level 35 and at least on my server they are always crowded as hell. SO I usually end up in East Karana now doing human guards as money
ygData.messageBody:
The Dwarven guards are level 35 and at least on my server they are always
crowded as hell. SO I usually end up in East Karana now doing human guards
as money doesn't matter to me anymore and 3-4 pp a loot is just fine.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: srutkowski@... <srutkowski@...>
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 10:41 AM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Guard Killing (Was Evil Characters)


>From: srutkowski@...
>
>
>
>Best guards you can kill, for exp and loot, are Trolls or Dwarves. If you
are
>an evil race- don't do the Troll Bashers, you'll loose the ability to go
into
>Grobb after one or two. If you are a good character- by all means kill the
>DWARVES. You can kill the two guards by the docks in Butcherblock
Mountains
>without taking any faction hits. Their weapons and coin loot off of one
dwarven
>guard is like 20pp. I don't remember what level they are, but I'm pretty
sure
>they are around 32 or so.
>
>Now, these guards don't do crap to save PCs. They just keep stuff from
>wandering into the dock area. At level 8, my ranger ran past them with an
aqua
>goblin wizard casting on him (these make mince meat out of level 8s). I
ran all
>the way to the docks before I died (which was well past the guards). I
have
>never seen them attack MOBs if they engauged with a PC, so no moral dilema
of
>removing the "protection of newbies".
>
>Hope that helps. They are a great source of income especially if you want
to
>start something expensive- like jewelcrafting.
>
>Tearfall- DE Necro
>16th Level of Pain and Suffering
>-amoung others-
>
>
>
>>This list is basically unmoderated. However abusive language will not be
tolerated
>
